top.author: @OurTownReno
top.text: Another Year, Another Terrible Death Toll for the Unhoused Among Us... Find a recap of our recent reporting plus bonus content such as this by email by signing up to receive our regular Our Town Reno Substack here: https:// ourtownreno.substack.com

options.comment: These numbers represent real people with real stories. We can't keep normalizing this.
Good journalism on tough topics matters. The more we understand the scope, the better we can address root causes.
Data helps, but connecting the dots between housing, healthcare, and support systems is where real change happens.

top.author: @sama
top.text: Yesterday we did a livestream. TL;DR: We have set internal goals of having an automated AI research intern by September of 2026 running on hundreds of thousands of GPUs, and a true automated AI researcher by March of 2028. We may totally fail at this goal, but given the

options.comment: Bold timeline! The jump from intern to researcher in 18 months will be the real test. What's the biggest gap you're seeing between current AI capabilities and actual research autonomy?
"We may totally fail" - the most honest thing any AI company has said in 2024 ðŸ˜… Respect for setting actual timelines instead of vague "soonâ„¢"
The infrastructure challenges alone are fascinating. Hundreds of thousands of GPUs coordinating research tasks... makes you wonder how much of the bottleneck is compute vs reasoning architecture.

top.author: @paulg
top.text: Jessica just sent an email to a friend of ours with a 4:1 exclamation point to period ratio.

options.comment: That's not enthusiasm, that's a cry for help!!!! See what I mean.
The punctuation-to-emotion ratio is a real indicator of communication style. Some people just express differently.
Email tone detection is surprisingly hard to get right. The same message can feel completely different based on punctuation alone.

top.author: @BurtReddington
top.text: Google has also made it IMPOSSIBLE to search for any email regardless of how exact you type the wording

options.comment: Gmail search feels like it's actively hiding emails from me at this point ðŸ˜…
Email search is broken across most providers. The indexing just can't keep up with the volume and complexity of modern inboxes.
This is exactly why I started thinking about better ways to organize and find emails. The current tools just aren't built for how we actually use email.

top.author: @RizukaRizu00
top.text: This is the best uninstal process > go to start>settings >click apps>installed app >find ubi connect>click the three dots and uninstall I hate this launcher for re enter email and password. Can you just remember my account for whole time ?

top.author: @WSJFreeEx
top.text: Landing a job often requires tolerating mild social discomfort. Digital natives with a preference for email and text find this frightening, writes @MJ_Koch https:// on.wsj.com/4qG6PqG

top.author: @AmazonHelp
top.text: Apologies for any negative experiences with your order, we know how frustrating that can be. If we've missed the estimated delivery date advised in your order conformation email then you can find some guidance here: https:// amzn.to/40vkgia. You can always check your order

top.author: @WSJFreeEx
top.text: Landing a job often requires cold introductions over phone calls, small talk during coffee chats and the risk of rejection in an interview. Digital natives with a preference for email and text find this frightening, writes @MJ_Koch

top.author: @Prathkum
top.text: Absolutely, we are all a little hesitant at first to change our workflow just to gain some speed. But AI flips that completely. For example, Low-code tools were never my thing. I never felt truly in control building with them. With AI though, I actually do feel in control.
